hero.title: Osaka
hero.subtitle: A fascinating city where thousand years of history meets modernity

highlights.title: Osaka Highlights
highlights.subtitle: Osaka is a fascinating city where Japanese history and modern culture blend together. From traditional temples to cutting-edge entertainment facilities, there's something for everyone.

osaka_castle.title: Osaka Castle
osaka_castle.description: A magnificent castle built by Toyotomi Hideyoshi. It becomes a beautiful cherry blossom spot in spring and offers scenic views throughout the seasons.

dotonbori.title: Dotonbori
dotonbori.description: The heart of Osaka's food culture. Enjoy diverse gourmet experiences alongside iconic signs like Glico and Kani Doraku.

usj.title: Universal Studios Japan
usj.description: A theme park featuring popular movie attractions. Immerse yourself in worlds like Harry Potter and Minions.

tips.title: Travel Tips
tips.subtitle: Information and tips to make the most of your Osaka experience.

spring.title: Spring (March - May)
spring.description: Cherry blossom season. Osaka Castle Park and the Mint Bureau's cherry blossom tunnel are especially recommended. The weather is mild and perfect for sightseeing.

summer.title: Summer (June - August)
summer.description: Summer festivals like Tenjin Matsuri are held. It's hot and humid, so remember to stay hydrated and take breaks in cool places.

autumn.title: Autumn (September - November)
autumn.description: Autumn foliage season. Expo Park and Minoo Park are beautiful autumn spots. The climate is comfortable and suitable for tourism.

winter.title: Winter (December - February)
winter.description: Beautiful illumination season. Osaka Castle Illuminage and Festival of Lights are held. The cold is milder than Tokyo.

transport.title: Transportation Tips
transport.tip1: Purchase the Osaka Amazing Pass for unlimited access to major tourist facilities and city transportation.
transport.tip2: Buy an ICOCA card for smooth use of trains and buses in the Kansai region.
transport.tip3: The subway's Midosuji and Chuo lines connect major tourist destinations.

manners.title: Cultural Etiquette
manners.tip1: Osaka people are more friendly than Tokyo residents, and you can enjoy conversations with shop staff.
manners.tip2: When eating okonomiyaki or takoyaki, use the provided chopsticks or picks.
manners.tip3: On escalators in Kansai, stand on the right side and leave the left side for people in a hurry (opposite to Tokyo).
